hackathon-description-text: Unituhack is the first student & staff hackathon, bringing them together to form a team for one day to co-create technological innovations and solutions to specific challenges found in universities.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor of Computer Science and Dean of the Faculty of Natural and Mathematical Sciences at King's College London
Venture Hunter at Emerge Venture Lab
Academic Enhancement and Course Leader, MA Ed at Buckinghamshire New University

hackathon-eligibility: To submit your project, you have to attend Unituhack London and be a student/developer/university staff member.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Subscription to lynda.com for a month

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 E Poultry Ave, London EC1A 9PT, Regatul Unit al Marii Britanii şi Irlandei de Nord

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How well does the solution solve the problem?

How well was the product built/designed?
Is it intuitive?

How many people does your solution have an impact on? 
Does it have an impact on both students and staff?
Does your product adapt to different types of users?
Has the team validated its assumptions?
Can your product be used in different departments and universities?

How original and unique is the idea?
Does it solve the problem better than other solution available?

hackathon-location-address: 1 E Poultry Ave, London EC1A 9PT, Regatul Unit al Marii Britanii şi Irlandei de Nord
hackathon-description-header: Students, staff and technologists come together for one day to enhance higher education through technology.
